meanings.sent1: She completed her labours in the garden under the hot sun.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker's labours built the sturdy bridge.
meanings.sent3: The ant's labours in gathering food for winter paid off.
meanings.sent4: Her labours in studying for the exam bore fruit with a high score.
meanings.sent5: The farmer's labours in tending to the crops were evident in the bountiful harvest.

meanings.sent1: The doctor assisted the mother during her labours in the delivery room.
meanings.sent2: The midwife guided her through the labours of giving birth.
meanings.sent3: The labours of labor were intense but worth it for the new parents.
meanings.sent4: The mother's labours brought forth new life into the world.
meanings.sent5: The labours of childbirth are a natural part of the miracle of life.

meanings.definition: To work hard; to make great effort.
meanings.sent1: He labours tirelessly to provide for his family.
meanings.sent2: She labours day and night to achieve her dreams.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel labours to gather nuts for the winter ahead.
meanings.sent4: The artist labours over every detail of her masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The team labours together to reach their common goal.
